a3f1abf485.gt:
Mix the Italian seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil and rub over chicken.
Refrigerate for 4-24 hours.
In a saucepan over medium-low heat add the tomatoes, 2 tsp olive oil, 2 tsp balsamic vinegar, and seasoning as desired.
In a large pan bring 6 cups of water to a boil and cook the pasta according the package directions.
Allow the tomatoes to simmer for 20 minutes, then add the mixed veggies and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes (I used a frozen blend).
Grill the chicken until an internal temp of 165 F is reached (approx.
7 minutes per side).
Pour the tomatoes over the pasta and top with a chicken breast.

38747a5ef7.gt:
Prepare a large ice bath.
In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, blanch the cauliflower until just starting to soften, 1 to 2 minutes.
Drain and transfer to the ice bath to cool.
Drain again.
In a large saucepan, combine the vinegar with the water, sugar, curry powder and 1 tablespoon of salt and bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Remove from the heat, stir in the cauliflower and let cool completely.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Drain the cauliflower; reserve the brine to pickle more vegetables, if desired.
Preheat the oven to 375.
On a large rimmed baking sheet, toss the cauliflower with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Roast for about 35 minutes, stirring once or twice, until tender and browned in spots.
Transfer the cauliflower to a platter and serve.

c6db02633a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Put the ricotta in a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl and let stand 10 minutes to remove the excess liquid.
Transfer the cheese to a bowl and add the eggs, salt and pepper, to taste and the orange zest.
Stir until well combined.
Transfer the mixture to an 8-ounce shallow baking and serving dish and put on a baking sheet.
Bake in the center of the oven until puffed and beginning to brown, about 35 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Serve warm with olives and baguette or your favorite bread and enjoy!
c6db02633a.pred:
To recreate the baked fresh ricotta with olives, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the fresh ricotta, minced garlic, salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg.
3. Add the chopped olives and mix well.
4. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the ricotta mixture for 20-25 minutes, or until it is set and slightly golden brown.
6. Remove the baked ricotta mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your homemade baked fresh ricotta with olives!

8d838c9253.gt:
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.
Add celery, carrot, and onion to pan; cook 12 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add broth and next 4 ingredients (through pepper); bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer 12 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Add chicken to pan; cook 3 minutes or until chicken is done.
Sprinkle with cheese.
8d838c9253.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Cook the chicken: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and any desired herbs or spices. Place the chicken in a baking dish and cook for about 30-45 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

2. Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, and cook the pasta according to the package instructions. Drain the pasta and set aside.

3. Prepare the chickpea stew: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Add the chickpeas, tomatoes, and any desired herbs or spices. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the stew over medium heat for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chickpeas are tender and the flavors have melded together.

4. Combine the ingredients: In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, pasta, and chickpea stew. Stir to combine all the ingredients.

5. Serve: Portion the meal into individual servings and serve immediately. Enjoy your delicious chicken, pasta, and chickpea stew meal!

07d9e9cc9b.gt:
Combine water, sugar, salt, yeast, oil, and enough flour to make a soft dough.
(You may need more than 3 1/2 cups.)
Knead for 3-4 minutes.
On a greased counter, break off pieces of dough and roll into thin ropes that are about 1 1/2 times the length of your skewers.
Twist the rope around the skewer and place on a greased cookie sheet.
Repeat till all dough is used.
Let twists rise till doubled, about 30 minutes.
While they are baking, combine the glaze ingredients and let site while the bread twists bake so the flavors will blend.
Bake twists at 375F for about 12-15 minutes or till golden brown.
Remove from oven and brush with the butter glaze.
Try not to drool.
07d9e9cc9b.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ingredients for the dough: flour, sugar, yeast, salt, and warm water. Mix until a smooth dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
5. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
6. Roll out the dough into long, thin strips.
7. Brush the strips with melted butter and roll them up to form twists.
8. Place the twists on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the twists in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the twists from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

These steps should help someone prepare the Incredible Bread Twists displayed in the photo.

8ff16b99b6.gt:
Cream the butter and sugar
Beat in the egg
Add malt and beat together
Add the flour & salt if using and mix into a ball I changed to a spoon half way as mixture was going every where lol.
Put dough in the fridge for 30-60 minutes.
I left mine for 60.
This makes the dough easier to roll out.
10 minutes before you roll out the dough Pre heat oven to 150 & line a baking tray with greaseproof paper
Roll out the dough to the thickness of a 1 coin and cut out in rectangular shapes or squares,
Place on the tray and bake for 15-20 minutes until edges go lightly brown.
Mine took 18 minutes
Leave to cool a while on the tray before transferring to a cooling rack
Enjoy with a glass of milk or favourite brew.
8ff16b99b6.pred:
1. First, gather the necessary ingredients: proper malted milk biscuits, butter, and sugar.
2. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
3. Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
4. Add the malted milk biscuits to the butter mixture, and mix until well combined.
5. Press the biscuit mixture into a greased and floured 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Bake the biscuit mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
7. Allow the biscuits to cool for a few minutes before cutting them into desired shapes using a sharp knife.
8. Serve the biscuits warm, and enjoy your delicious homemade malted milk biscuits.

[/SYS]

8ffd977e2f.gt:
In 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat, heat Italian sausages and 1/4 cup water to boiling.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Remove cover and cook until sausages are browned, about 15 minutes.
Remove sausages to cutting board.
When cool enough to handle, cut diagonally into 1/4-inch-thick slices.
While sausages are cooking, cut eggplant into 1/2-inch chunks.
In drippings remaining in skillet, over medium heat, cook eggplant and 2 tablespoons water until eggplant is tender, about 15 minutes, stirring often and adding additional water if necessary to keep eggplant from sticking.
Add spaghetti sauce and sausages; over high heat, heat to boiling.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in saucepot, prepare ziti macaroni as label directs but do not use salt in water.
Drain ziti; return to saucepot.
Add spaghetti-sauce mixture; over medium heat, heat through.
To serve, spoon ziti into 8 individual pasta bowls or dinner plates; top each serving with some ricotta cheese and cracked pepper.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if you like.
8ffd977e2f.pred:
1. Preparation:
- In a large skillet, cook the sausage until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
- In the same skillet, cook the eggplant slices until tender.
- Add the cooked sausage back into the skillet and stir to combine.
- Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and stir to combine.
- Season the dish with salt, pepper, and any additional desired herbs or spices.
- Serve the dish over a bed of cooked pasta.

2. Cooking Tips:
- Ensure that the sausage is cooked through and browned before adding it to the dish.
- Cook the eggplant slices until tender, but not mushy.
- Add the cooked pasta to the skillet at the right moment to ensure that it is heated through and properly combined with the sausage and eggplant.
- Season the dish with salt, pepper, and any desired herbs or spices to enhance the flavors.
- Serve the dish over a bed of cooked pasta to create a balanced and satisfying meal.

3. Variations:
- You can add other ingredients to the dish, such as onions, mushrooms, or bell peppers, to create a more complex flavor profile.
- You can also experiment with different types of pasta, such as fusilli, penne, or farfalle, to create a unique twist on the dish.
- You can use different types of sausage, such as chicken sausage or turkey sausage, to cater to various dietary preferences or restrictions.

In conclusion, the sausage and eggplant pasta dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that can be easily customized to suit individual tastes. By following the provided cooking tips and variations, you can create a unique and enjoyable dish for yourself or others to enjoy.

ea0996a6a7.gt:
start be heating your water & white sugar & cinnamon stick together on high heat about 3 minutes you just want your sugar to desolve.
Now add in all your other ingredients lower temperatures to med- high heat stir well cook down 20-25 minutes consistently stiring till desired consistency.
Enjoy!
ea0996a6a7.pred:
To recreate the Cranberry & Apple Chutney, follow these steps:
1. Gather the ingredients: cranberries, apples, sugar, and spices such as cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.
2. Wash and peel the apples and cranberries, and chop them into small pieces.
3. In a large saucepan, combine the chopped apples and cranberries with the sugar and spices.
4. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the apples are tender and the cranberries have burst.
5. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the chutney for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it has thickened and cooled slightly.
6. Store the chutney in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks or in the freezer for up to 3 months.

Enjoy your homemade Cranberry & Apple Chutney!

a6a539fdd1.gt:
Season the thighs with adobo.
Heat the olive oil and cook the thighs.
Add the onion and cooked them till tender.
Add the vegetables, honey, basil, italian seasoning and tomato sauce.
And let it simmer for about 8 minutes...Enjoy
a6a539fdd1.pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including chicken, vegetables, and honey.
2. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
3. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat some oil over medium heat.
4. Add the chicken and cook until it is browned on all sides, then remove it from the pot and set aside.
5. Add the vegetables to the pot, and cook until they are tender.
6. In a small bowl, mix the honey with a splash of water to create a honey glaze.
7. Pour the honey glaze over the vegetables and stir to coat them evenly.
8. Return the chicken to the pot, and pour in enough water to cover the chicken and vegetables.
9. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
10. Season the stew with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the stew hot, garnished with a sprinkle of chopped fresh herbs if desired.

By following these instructions, you will be able to prepare a delicious and appetizing Easy Honey Veggie Chicken Stew.

22b18abc2f.gt:
*adding potatoes and corn are optional
Add all ingredients, except shrimp to a large saucepan on high heat.
Bring to a boil for 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low.
Add the shrimp and cook until bright pink, about 5 minutes.
Drain the shrimp from the cooking liquid and place in a serving dish.
Chill or eat while warm, enjoy!!!
!
22b18abc2f.pred:
As a chef, I would first gather the necessary ingredients for the dish, which typically includes shrimp, aromatics such as garlic, ginger, and onions, and a sauce like soy sauce, oyster sauce, or a combination of both. I would then prepare the shrimp by cleaning, peeling, and de-veining them, and then marinate them in the chosen sauce for a few hours.

Next, I would heat a pan or wok with oil and cook the aromatics until they are fragrant. Then, I would add the marinated shrimp, cooking them until they are pink and fully cooked. Once the shrimp are cooked, I would remove them from the pan and set aside.

In the same pan, I would add the sauce and cook it until it thickens and coats the shrimp evenly. Finally, I would serve the dish on a plate, garnished with some chopped green onions or cilantro, and enjoy the delicious drunken shrimp.

Please note that this is a simplified explanation, and there might be variations in the actual cooking process depending on the specific recipe and personal preferences.

f4a5f6209b.gt:
preheat oven to 450F
mix together dry ingredients.
in a seperate bowl, mix wet.
slowly add the wet to the dry, and combine until just mixed.
roll out on a lightly floured surface, and use a cutter of choice to create shapes (i used the top of a drinking glass).
bake for about 15 minutes.
f4a5f6209b.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients, such as teff flour, almond flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the wet ingredients, including eggs, almond milk, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until a dough forms.
5. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to your desired thickness and cut out biscuits using a biscuit cutter or a round cookie cutter.
6. Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the biscuits for 12-15 minutes or until they are golden brown.
8. While the biscuits are baking, prepare the strawberry-pineapple jam by combining the strawberries, pineapple, and sugar in a saucepan. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the fruit is soft and the sugar has dissolved.
9. Allow the biscuits to cool for a few minutes before spreading the strawberry-pineapple jam on top of each biscuit.
10. Serve the gluten-free teff biscuits with strawberry-pineapple jam warm or at room temperature.

Enjoy your delicious gluten-free teff biscuits with strawberry-pineapple jam!

331c22eb1b.gt:
In a small Mason jar, or jar of choice, combine oats, chia seeds, ground flaxseeds, cinnamon, and sea salt.
Add milk and Greek yogurt.
Stir everything together and place the lid on the jar and give the mixture a good shake to combine the ingredients.
Place the lid back on the jar and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, you can serve oats either right from the jar or in a bowl.
Simply serve with a sprinkle of sliced almonds, fresh blueberries, and some brown sugar, if desired (it is actually sweet enough if you use vanilla yogurt though!
).
331c22eb1b.pred:
To cook the Blueberry Overnight Oats with Chia and Flax, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup rolled oats, 1 cup unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 cup blueberries, 1/4 cup chia seeds, and 1/4 cup flax seeds.

2. Stir the mixture until well combined.

3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate it overnight.

4. In the morning, add 1/4 cup of your favorite yogurt to the mixture and stir well.

5. Serve the Blueberry Overnight Oats immediately or refrigerate for a few more hours before serving.

This dish is a delicious and nutritious breakfast option that combines the natural sweetness of blueberries with the health benefits of chia and flax seeds. The overnight soaking process allows the oats to soften and absorb the liquid, creating a creamy texture that is perfect for breakfast.

0998cbac3e.gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, 1 cup white flour, brown sugar, baking powder and salt.
Using a pastry blender, or two knives scissors-fashion, cut butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Add nuts or wheat berries.
Stir in the maple syrup and egg and just enough milk so that dough leaves side of bowl and forms a ball.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; gently roll in flour to coat.
Knead lightly; if dough is very soft, roll in flour again.
Transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet.
Pat or roll into an 8-inch disk; cut into 8 wedges, but do not separate.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Immediately remove from baking sheet, and carefully separate.
Serve warm.
0998cbac3e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the egg and milk, stirring until the dough comes together.
5. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
6. Cut the dough into scone shapes using a scone cutter or a round cookie cutter.
7. Place the scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the scones for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and set.
9. Allow the scones to cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before serving.

10a4bdfe37.gt:
Cook the wild rice according to the directions on the package.
Wild rice generally takes 55-60 minutes to cook.
While thats cooking, in a large soup pot, melt the butter and saute the leeks, carrots, celery, mushrooms, garlic and thyme on medium high heat.
Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the vegetables have softened, stirring occasionally.
Add the flour and stir until blended into the vegetables.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Once boiling, cover, turn the heat down to low, and simmer for 30 minutes.
At the 30 minute point, add the wild rice, chives and cooked and diced chicken.
Stir in the cream, half-n-half and sherry.
Cook until thoroughly heated.
Add salt and pepper to taste.

01a4e9a11b.gt:
in large frying pan saute with olive oil - thinly sliced onion & thinly sliced garlic until lightly blanched.
add sausage & ground beef.
saute until sausage & beef are braised.
add some wine.
transfer to a large pan.
add halved cherry tomatoes & sliced zucchini.
saute until tomatoes begin to wrinkle.
add V8 & allow to reach a simmer.
add pesto, oregano & thyme.
reduce to level of a thin sauce.
add corn starch & thicken.
add more wine.
last add parsley & chives.
season with salt & fresh pepper.
reduce to sauce thickness (if it needs liquid add more white wine).
Allow to cool & refrigerate overnight for flavors to be infused in the sauce.
Serve over al dente pasta and top with grated romano cheese.

To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. Typically, this involves boiling the spaghetti in salted water until it reaches the desired tenderness.

68a1ebd22c.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, cardamom and salt in a large bowl.
Whisk egg and water together in a small bowl.
Make a well in center of dry ingredients and add egg mixture.
Mix together gradually with a fork until mixture forms a soft dough.
If it's too sticky, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of flour (one at a time).
Cover dough with a wet towel or plastic wrap and leave 30 minutes or longer.
Heat 4 cups of oil in a deep, heavy pot (cast iron is preferable) until is reaches 360F
While oil is heating, roll dough out on a floured surface into a rectangle 1/2 inch thick.
Use a sharp knife to cut into 20 equal rectangles.
Fry maandazi in batches of 5, for about 5 minutes per batch, turning to brown both sides.
Hint: Turn the mandaazi before it gets too puffy, or the air bubbles will prevent you from turning it at all.
Remove from oil when both sides are golden brown.
Serve warm, dipped in powdered sugar if desired.

4. Add the milk, melted butter, and eggs to the bowl, mixing until a smooth batter forms.
5. Grease a baking sheet or a muffin tin with cooking spray or butter.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking sheet or muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. Bake the muffins in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

3bcfc9dd72.gt:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Drizzle olive oil on a rimmed baking sheet.
Spread spinach leaves in a thick layer covering the baking sheet.
Arrange onions and artichokes over the spinach, and drizzle the marinade from the jar over the entire salad.
Sprinkle with the cheese (and sausage, if you wish).
Bake for about 10 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted but NOT crispy.

To recreate the hot spinach and artichoke salad, follow these steps:
1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash the spinach and artichokes thoroughly.
2. Cook the spinach: Cook the spinach in boiling water until it is wilted and tender. Drain and set aside.
3. Cook the artichokes: Cook the artichokes in boiling water until they are tender. Drain and set aside.

7a39ad4f0a.gt:
In a large pot, combine the stock with the carrots, celery, onion, leek, potato, ginger, cumin, coriander, and cayenne, and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over low heat until the vegetables are tender, 20-25 minutes.
Working in batches, puree the soup in a food processor(or blender), then return to the pot.
Stir in buttermilk and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reheat gently.
Ladle into bowls, and sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
Enjoy!
7a39ad4f0a.pred:
To recreate the Silky Spicy Carrot Soup, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- 2 cups of carrots, peeled and chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1/2 cup of vegetable or chicken broth
- 1/2 cup of water
- 1/4 cup of olive oil
- 1/4 cup of honey
- 1/4 cup of grated ginger
- 1/4 cup of ground cumin
- 1/4 cup of ground coriander
- 1/4 cup of ground turmeric
- 1/4 cup of red pepper flakes (optional)
- Salt and pepper to taste

2. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the carrots, broth, water, honey, ginger, cumin, coriander, turmeric, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.
5. Using an immersion blender or transferring the mixture to a blender, puree the soup until smooth and silky.
6. Serve the Silky Spicy Carrot Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream or yogurt, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Silky Spicy Carrot Soup!

80c8683fe0.gt:
To toast nuts, preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Spread nuts out on a baking sheet and bake until lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
Nuts can be stored in the refrigerator.
Wash and separate endive into leaves.
Dry with a clean tea towel.
If not serving right away, place in a plastic bag and refrigerate for up to 1 day.
Whisk olive oil with vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper.
Taste and add more vinegar if needed.
Dressing can be left at room temperature for several hours or refrigerated in a sealed jar.
Vinaigrette becomes cloudy when cold.
When ready to serve, let vinaigrette come to room temperature.
Arrange endive on individual plates.
Shake vinaigrette and drizzle over salad.
Scatter toasted nuts over top.
Serve right away.
80c8683fe0.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:

1. Wash the endive thoroughly to remove any dirt or bacteria.
2. Cut the endive into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the endive pieces with a vinaigrette dressing.
4. Toast the nuts in a dry pan over medium heat until they are golden brown.
5. Once the nuts are toasted, let them cool for a few minutes.
6. Add the toasted nuts to the endive salad.
7. Serve the salad on a plate, garnished with a drizzle of vinaigrette dressing if desired.

Enjoy your delicious endive salad with toasted nuts!

ea6256f97c.gt:
Beat margarine or butter and granulated sugar in a medium mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, sour cream, and vanilla; beat until well combined.
Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add to butter sugar mixture; beat until combined.
Stir in raisins and 2/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Spread batter evenly into a greased and floured 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Stir together brown sugar, cinnamon, pecans, and 1/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Sprinkle evenly over batter and pat down.
Bake in a 350F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cooled.
ea6256f97c.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Add the eggs, milk, and melted butter, and mix until a smooth batter forms.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices.
7. Serve the cake warm, with a cup of coffee or tea, and enjoy!

[/SYS]

efba40ac8b.gt:
In a medium saucepan, bring 2 1/4 cups of water to a boil.
Add the rice and a generous pinch of salt.
Stir once, cover and simmer over low heat until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let steam, covered, for 20 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork and spread it out on a plate to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, toast the tea over moderately low heat, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Transfer the tea to a plate and let cool, then finely crumble with your fingers.
In the skillet, melt the butter.
Add the onion and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until very soft but not browned, about 12 minutes; season with salt.
Add the rice and tea and cook over moderate heat, stirring gently, until the rice is hot and the tea is evenly distributed, about 2 minutes.
Gently fold in the crabmeat and cook until warmed through, about 2 minutes.
Season generously with pepper.
Transfer to a platter and garnish with sesame seeds.
Serve right away.
efba40ac8b.pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients for the dish, including crab meat, rice, vegetables, and any additional seasonings or sauces that you prefer.
2. Wash and clean the crab meat thoroughly, removing any shells or unwanted parts.
3. Cook the rice according to the package instructions, usually by boiling it in water until it is fully cooked and fluffy.
4. While the rice is cooking, chop the vegetables into bite-sized pieces. You can use any vegetables that you prefer, such as bell peppers, carrots, or onions.
5. In a large skillet or wok, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped vegetables and cook them until they are tender but still crisp.
6. Add the cooked rice to the skillet or wok, stirring to combine the ingredients evenly.
7. Add the crab meat to the skillet or wok, stirring to ensure that it is evenly distributed throughout the dish.
8. If desired, add any additional seasonings or sauces to enhance the flavor of the dish. You can use soy sauce, oyster sauce, or a combination of these to suit your taste.
9. Cook the dish over medium heat for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until the crab meat is heated through and the flavors have melded together.
10. Serve the Fragrant Crab Rice immediately, garnished with fresh herbs or a drizzle of sauce, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious and appetizing meal!

6eccb4afe2.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain pasta in a large colander over a bowl, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid.
Rinse pasta under cold water; drain.
Drain tuna, reserving 2 tablespoons oil.
Grate 2 teaspoons rind from lemon; squeeze 3 tablespoons juice.
Combine reserved oil, rind, and juice in a large bowl; stir with a whisk.
Add pasta to oil mixture, tossing to coat.
Fold in tuna and apple.
Remove fronds from fennel bulb; finely chop fronds to measure 3 tablespoons.
Remove and discard stalks.
Thinly slice fennel bulb.
Stir fronds and sliced fennel into pasta mixture.
Add reserved pasta liquid and 1/2 teaspoon salt, tossing to coat pasta salad evenly.Sustainable Choice: Industry label regulations require solid white tuna to be from the albacore variety.
6eccb4afe2.pred:
To recreate the Tuna-Fennel Pasta Salad, follow these instructions:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, using a suitable sauce like pesto or vinaigrette.
2. While the pasta is cooking, chop the fennel bulb and any other desired vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, fennel, and any other desired vegetables.
4. Add the tuna to the bowl, breaking it into small pieces if necessary.
5. Drizzle the dressing of your choice over the salad, and toss to combine.
6. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Tuna-Fennel Pasta Salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Please note that these instructions are based on the image provided and may not be the exact steps taken by the chef in the image.

dba5f2108e.gt:
For the pork medallions: Heat grill to medium heat.
Place pork medallions in a bowl, add olive oil and spices.
Mix until all the pork is covered in the olive oil mixture.
Place pork on grill and cook 5 minutes per side.
Cover and let it rest for 5 minutes.
For the asparagus: Cut off the ends of the asparagus.
Place in a bowl and add olive oil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
Wrap each piece of asparagus with prosciutto.
Place asparagus on grill set on medium heat.
Turn every couple of minutes until asparagus is fork tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.
dba5f2108e.pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Grill the pork medallions according to the recipe's instructions.
- Wrap the asparagus spears with prosciutto slices.

2. Preheat the grill:
- Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.

3. Grill the pork medallions:
- Place the pork medallions on the grill and cook them until they are fully cooked through and have a nice charred exterior.

4. Grill the prosciutto-wrapped asparagus:
- Place the prosciutto-wrapped asparagus on the grill and cook them until they are tender and slightly charred.

5. Serve:
- Remove the cooked pork medallions and prosciutto-wrapped asparagus from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
- Serve the grilled pork medallions and prosciutto-wrapped asparagus on a plate, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

6. Enjoy your meal!

Please note that these are general steps and may vary depending on the specific recipe and grilling method used.

8a7f317318.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray a 9-inch glass pie plate with cooking spray or use a silicon pie plate.
In a 10-inch skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat.
Stir occasionally.
Drain.
Add salt, garlic powder and Cajun seasoning.
Spread in pie plate.
Sprinkle with cheese.
In a small bowl stir the Original Bisquick mix, milk, and eggs with a wire wish until blended.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake about 20-25 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
You can add to your slice ketchup, BBQ sauce, bacon or anything else you would normally top your cheeseburger with.

To prepare the cheeseburger pie, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, onion, egg, breadcrumbs, and seasonings. Form the mixture into patties.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil to the skillet. Cook the patties until they are cooked through, flipping them occasionally.
4. Once the patties are cooked, remove them from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.

7. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the cheeseburger pie cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cheeseburger pie!

42aebc99ee.gt:
Chop strawberries.
Divide 260g (1 cup) vanilla yoghurt among four serving glasses.
Divide one-third of the strawberries among the glasses.
Sprinkle 2 tsp Milo over the strawberries in each glass.
Continue layering with 520g (2 cups) vanilla yoghurt, the remaining strawberries and 40g (1/3 cup) Milo.
Serve.

ddf57796e4.gt:
Drain pineapple, reserving 1 cup of chunks, 1/2 cup juice (reserving juice for other purposes).
Combine 1/2 cup of the juice, ginger, soy sauce, cilantro and meat in bowl.
Cover bowl, marinate for 15 minutes.
In large, nonstick skillet, heat oil, add garlic, saute 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Remove the meat from the marinade, place in the skillet.
Stir fry 5 minutes, just until cooked through, remove the meat and keep warm.
Combine marinade and cornstarch in bowl.
Add the beans, chilies, pepper and marinade to skillet; stir fry 4 minutes (or until veggies are crisp tender and mixture is thickened).
Stir in 1 cup pineapple chunks, scallions and meat; heat through.
ddf57796e4.pred:
1. Gather the necessary ingredients:
- Beef (sliced)
- Pineapple (fresh or canned)
- Onions (sliced)
- Bell peppers (sliced)
- Soy sauce
- Oyster sauce
- Vegetable oil
- Garlic (minced)
- Ginger (minced)
- Salt and pepper
- Rice (optional)

2. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash the beef and pineapple thoroughly.
- Cut the onions and bell peppers into thin strips.
- Mince the garlic and ginger.
- Season the beef with salt and pepper.
- Slice the pineapple and onions.
- Chop the bell peppers into small pieces.

3. Heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
4. Add the minced garlic and ginger, stirring constantly for about 1 minute.
5. Add the beef and cook until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
6. Add the onions and bell peppers, stirring to combine.
7. Pour in the soy sauce and oyster sauce, stirring to coat the ingredients evenly.
8. Add the pineapple, stirring to combine.
9. Cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the beef is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
10. Serve the Pineapple Beef Stir-Fry over rice, if desired.

7b0bd717e5.gt:
Soften the butter in the microwave and leave to cool slightly.
Sift the cake flour.
Separate the eggs.
Make meringue by whisking the egg whites, adding the sugar gradually until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks and whisk in the melted butter a little at a time.
Then add the milk and the sifted flour, and mix gently.
Add in the meringue from Step 2 and carefully fold it in with a rubber spatula.
Cook in a waffle maker.
(I set my waffle maker to the medium setting and cooked for 3-4 minutes.)
NOTE: Increasing the sugar to 50 g will produce deliciously sweet waffles that are great even without a topping (however, they'll be soft and moist as opposed to crunchy).
Recipe Photo The waffle pictured was dusted with powdered sugar and served with lightly whipped fresh cream (100 ml heavy cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, vanilla essence) and pineapple.
7b0bd717e5.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your waffle iron on medium heat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the egg whites, sugar, and a pinch of salt until the mixture is frothy and holds stiff peaks.
3. Gently fold in the flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
4. Fold in the melted butter until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
5. Pour the batter onto the preheated waffle iron, using a ladle or a spoon to create evenly distributed droplets.
6. Cook the waffles according to your waffle iron's instructions, typically until the edges are golden brown and the center is cooked through.
7. Remove the waffles from the waffle iron and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious light waffles made with meringue!

30ddae3add.gt:
Slice the sausage, clean the vegetables and slice the zucchini.
Other vegetables will work for this as well (some ideas are mushrooms, onions, peppers, or tomatoes).
Throw everything in the pot except the cream and Parmesan.
Bring to a boil as then simmer for about 10 minutes.
Stir frequently and check noodles for doneness at about 7 minutes.
Remove from heat once the noodles are done.
Any extra liquid is fine as the pasta will dry out after sitting for a minute or two.
Add the cream and Parmesan (you can add a couple tablespoons of olive oil instead of cream should you choose to).
Stir well.
Enjoy!
30ddae3add.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the sausages over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Remove the sausages from the pot and set aside.
3. Add the pasta to the pot and cook according to the package instructions, usually boiling for about 8-10 minutes.
4. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and return it to the pot.
5. Add the sausages back to the pot and stir to combine.
6. Pour in the marinara sauce and stir to coat the pasta evenly.
7. Transfer the pot to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
8. Serve the One Pot Sausage Pasta immediately, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

[/SYS]

3c81571916.gt:
Preheat oven to 375, in a large bowl combine all ingredients mix well.
lightly spray your 8x8 baking dish and add meat mixture to form an loaf.
bake uncovered about an hour or until thermometer reaches 170.
3c81571916.pred:
To recreate the meatloaf squared, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, onion, egg, ketchup, mustard, and seasonings. Mix well.
3. Shape the beef mixture into a square or rectangular shape, about 1-inch thick.
4. Place the meatloaf on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Bake the meatloaf in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (72°C).
6. Remove the meatloaf from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into squares.
7. Serve the meatloaf squared on a plate, garnished with your choice of side dishes and condiments.

Enjoy your delicious meatloaf squared!

6b99a23505.gt:
Peel the bulb of garlic, which should equal around 10 cloves.
I prefer to mash it finely with a mortal and pestle (the old-fashioned way) but feel free to use a food processor.
Combine the salt and garlic cloves in whatever manner you choose, and grind them up well.
Then prepare the boxed mashed potatoes as directed for the smallest serving possible.
(Youll need about 1/2 cup.
2-3 servings on a box of mashed potatoes is about 1 cup.
So feel free to take out a spoon and eat the other half of the mashed potatoes.)
Let the mashed potatoes cool.
Go back to the garlic, and add the mayonnaise, the lemon juice and about half of the oil (about 1/4 of a cup).
Blend together in processor or blender.
Then add about 1/4 cup of the mashed potatoes and half of the oil you have left (about 1/8 of a cup).
Blend more.
(You may need to stick a spoon down in there to ensure that it mixes thoroughly).
Now add the remainder of your mashed potatoes and oil.
Give it a good final blend.
You may need to add more oil or potatoes, depending on whether you want it thicker or thinner.
Serve with pita bread, pita chips, chicken kabobs, or my Kafta (Kofta) recipe that Ive posted here in my recipe box.
Enjoy!
6b99a23505.pred:
1. Ingredients:
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 1/2 cup of tahini
- 1/2 cup of lemon juice
- 1/4 cup of water
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Optional: 1/4 cup of olive oil

2. Preparation:
- Peel the garlic and chop it finely.
- In a blender or food processor, combine the garlic, tahini, lemon juice, water, salt, and pepper.
- Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
- If desired, add the olive oil to the mixture for a creamier consistency.

3. Serving:
- Pour the toum into a bowl and serve it as a dip for pita bread, vegetables, or other dishes.

4. Variations:
- You can also use the toum as a base for other dishes, such as a sandwich spread, a salad dressing, or a topping for grilled meats or vegetables.

5. Tips:
- Toum can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a week, or frozen for up to 3 months.
- If the toum becomes too thick, you can thin it out with a bit more water.
- You can also add other ingredients, such as chopped parsley, cumin, or cayenne pepper, to customize the flavor to your taste.

b9f129d26e.gt:
Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add ham, green chiles, and mushrooms; saute 5 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Wipe pan clean.Place 1 tortilla in pan.
Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over half of tortilla; arrange 1/2 cup ham mixture over cheese.
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese; fold in half.
Cook 1 minute on each side or until cheese melts.
Repeat procedure with remaining tortillas, cheese, and ham mixture.
b9f129d26e.pred:
To recreate the Ham and Mushroom Quesadillas, follow these steps:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Ham: Slice the ham into thin strips.
- Mushrooms: Clean and chop the mushrooms into bite-sized pieces.
- Cheese: Shred the desired amount of cheese (e.g., cheddar, Monterey Jack, or a blend).
- Tortillas: Preheat a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Place the tortillas on a plate and warm them for a few seconds on each side.

2. Assemble the quesadillas:
- Place a tortilla on the skillet or griddle.
- Spread a layer of cheese on the tortilla.
- Add a layer of sliced ham and mushrooms on top of the cheese.
- Add another layer of cheese on top of the ham and mushrooms.
- Place another tortilla on top of the cheese and ham mixture.
- Cook the quesadillas until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the tortillas are crispy and golden brown.

3. Serve and enjoy:
- Cut the quesadillas into wedges and serve them immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Ham and Mushroom Quesadillas!

b4611b4385.gt:
Heat should be medium-high and rack about 4 inches from fire.
Put shrimp and garlic in a food processor and pulse until just chopped; remove to a large bowl.
Working in batches, grind pork fat until just chopped (be careful not to overprocess).
Add to bowl.
Then grind meat until just chopped, again being careful not to overprocess; add to bowl.
Mix shrimp, pork fat and meat with soy sauce, scallions, cilantro, chili and ginger; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Shape into 8 patties.
Grill about 4 minutes, then turn and cook for a total of 8 to 10 minutes, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Garnish with scallions, cilantro, cabbage and pickled pepper, to taste.

75b28019b4.gt:
Heat oil in medium skillet on medium-high heat.
Add chicken; cook 7 min.
on each side or until cooked through (170F).
Meanwhile, prepare Dinner as directed on package, substituting large skillet for the saucepan.
Add tomatoes, onions and parsley to prepared dinner; mix lightly.
Top with the chicken.
75b28019b4.pred:
1. Preparation:
- Wash and clean the chicken thoroughly.
- Remove the chicken from the bone and cut it into bite-sized pieces.
- Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and any other desired herbs or spices.
- Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
- Add a small amount of oil to the pan and cook the chicken until it is browned and cooked through.
- Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
- Add more oil to the pan if needed, and cook the onions and peppers until they are soft and slightly browned.
- Add the garlic and cook for a few seconds, then add the tomatoes and cook until they are soft and slightly mushy.
- Add the cooked chicken back to the pan and stir to combine the ingredients.
- Add any desired sauce or seasoning, such as barbecue sauce, ketchup, or a mixture of herbs and spices.
- Simmer the dish over low heat for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
- Serve the chicken mac over rice or noodles, and enjoy!

2. Cooking Time:
- The cooking time for the chicken mac will vary depending on the size of the chicken pieces and the heat of the pan. However, it is generally around 15-20 minutes.

3. Serving:
- Serve the chicken mac over rice or noodles, as desired, and enjoy the delicious, hearty meal.

dbf1079c1d.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Lightly oil a 12-inch springform pan or 12 cups of a muffin tin.
In a small pot, combine the water, cinnamon stick and cloves and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Turn off the heat and let the spices steep for 15 minutes.
Strain.
In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, whip the olive oil and brown sugar together until fluffy.
Add the spice water, petimezi, orange peel and tsipouro (or ouzo or grappa).
Mix well.
Dissolve the baking soda in the orange juice and stir into the petimezi mixture.
Sift 5 cups of flour into a medium bowl.
Gently whisk the flour into the petimezi mixture.
If the batter is loose, add a little more flour.
Stir in the chocolate chips, if using and scrape the batter into the springform or muffin cups.
Toss the granulated sugar and sesame seeds together and sprinkle over the cake.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 50 minutes for the cake, 40 to 45 minutes for the cupcakes.
Serve the cake as is, or with a bit of petimezi or chocolate syrup drizzled over or around it.
Serve the cupcakes, if making, the same way.
Petimezopita is delicious with vanilla ice cream, too.
dbf1079c1d.pred:
To recreate the Grape Molasses Cake, follow these instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the following ingredients:
- 1 cup (200g) all-purpose flour
- 1 cup (200g) granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup (120g) unsalted butter, softened
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup (120g) grape molasses
- 1/2 cup (120g) milk
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/4 cup (60g) chopped nuts (optional)
- 1/4 cup (60g) chopped dried fruit (optional)

3. Mix the ingredients until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
5. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the cake is completely cool, you can decorate it with a dusting of powdered sugar, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Grape Molasses Cake!

7ee62fccb3.gt:
Combine all of the ingredients in a pot and stir to coat the carrots evenly.
Set over a medium heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until tender.
7ee62fccb3.pred:
1. Gather the necessary ingredients: carrots, cardamom, fennel, and any other required spices or herbs.
2. Wash and peel the carrots, and chop them into bite-sized pieces.
3. Crush the cardamom pods to release the seeds, and then grind them in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
4. Chop the fennel bulb into bite-sized pieces.
5. In a large pot or pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped carrots, fennel, and crushed cardamom seeds. Cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender but still slightly crunchy.
6. Add any additional spices or herbs that you think would complement the dish.
7. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are cooked through and the flavors have melded together.
8. Serve the cooked carrots and fennel mixture over rice or with your preferred grain.

These steps will help you recreate the dish displayed in the photo, which features carrots scented with cardamom and fennel.

44be4e7085.gt:
Mix together the brown sugar, rice wine, and rice wine vinegar in a small bowl until smooth.
Combine the coconut milk and peanut butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
Heat and stir until the peanut butter melts, being careful to not allow the coconut milk to boil.
Stir the sugar mixture into the coconut milk mixture; pour into a bowl; stir in the soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, chili sauce, ginger, and fish sauce.
44be4e7085.pred:
To recreate the Thai-Style Peanut Sauce, follow these steps:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- 1 cup of peanuts
- 1/2 cup of peanut butter
- 1/4 cup of vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup of soy sauce
- 1/4 cup of sugar
- 1/4 cup of water
- 1/4 cup of lime juice
- 1/4 cup of fish sauce
- 1/4 cup of tamarind paste
- 1/4 cup of garlic
- 1/4 cup of ginger
- 1/4 cup of red chili flakes
- 1/4 cup of cilantro
- 1/4 cup of green onions
- 1/4 cup of lime zest
- 1/4 cup of sesame seeds
- 1/4 cup of cornstarch
- 1/4 cup of water

2. Prepare the sauce:

Pour enough water over the mixture to cover.
In a bowl, stir the fresh basil, chili powder, cinnamon, dried basil, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ground ginger, sea salt, and black pepper; stir into the slow cooker.
Cover the cooker, and cook on High for 8 hours.

fefd0facd1.gt:
Trim the bottoms of the asparagus and place in a shallow dish.

Grill over hot coals for 2 to 3 minutes, or until tender.
Serve immediately.

9cac29f01e.gt:
Mash the avocados roughly with a fork.
I like mine a bit chunky so I dont go too crazy with the mashing.
Add in the minced garlic, diced jalapeno and diced red onion.
Stir in the diced tomatoes.

I would then prepare the avocados by removing the pit and mashing them with a fork or a food processor. Next, I would chop the tomatoes and onions finely and mix them with the mashed avocados.

To add flavor, I would squeeze fresh lime juice over the mixture, and then season it with salt to taste. After combining all the ingredients, I would mix them well to ensure a smooth consistency.

ff146bd853.gt:
NOTES: You MUST use butter or oil; margarine will not work.
A large cast-iron skillet works best for this, but any large non-stick skillet will work.
This recipe will work with nearly any type of boneless fish fillets, but catfish seems to be one of the tastiest.
This recipe produces a LOT of smoke, so make sure you have a good vent above your stove, or open some doors and/or windows.
Mix all dry ingredients together.
Coat fillets evenly with mixture.
Heat small amount of butter or oil in skillet until hot.
Place fillets in skillet.
Cook 3-5 minutes on each side.
Change butter or oil if it gets too black.

- Catfish fillets (fresh or frozen)
- Olive oil
- Salt and pepper
- Fresh parsley
- Lemon wedges
- Breadcrumbs (optional)

2. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the catfish fillets and pat them dry with paper towels.
- Season the catfish fillets with Cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper.
- Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat.
- Add the seasoned catfish fillets to the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.

- Set aside.

4. Prepare the breading:

5. Cook the catfish:
- Heat the skillet with the cooked catfish fillets over medium-high heat.
- Cook the breaded catfish for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.

6. Serve:
- Place the cooked catfish on a plate and garnish with fresh parsley.
- Serve the Cajun Style Blackened Catfish with a side of rice or your preferred side dish.

Enjoy your delicious Cajun Style Blackened Catfish!

Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9"x13" casserole.
Cover with a layer of noodles (3 or 4 noodles should be enough).
Place ricotta in a bowl and add about 1/4 cup of water, stirring until blended.

Spread 1/3 of the remaining pasta sauce over the cheese.
Spread 1/3 of the vegetables over the sauce.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the mozzarella over the veggies.
Repeat twice starting with the noodles and ending with the mozzarella.
Cover and bake until the noodles are tender (35 to 40 minutes).
Remove cover and bake 5 minutes until cheese starts to become golden.
Remove from oven and allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

6a0d7996ca.gt:
Pour milk into pint-size glass jar, and stir in kefir grains.
Cover jar with several layers of cheesecloth or paper towels, and secure with rubber band.
Store jar at room temperature out of direct sunlight and allow kefir to ferment until thickened.
(Healthy kefir grains will thicken milk in 24 hours, though this process may take as few as 12 hours in warmer temperatures, or as long as 48 hours in cooler temperatures.)
Check kefir periodically to gauge thickness.
When mixture reaches desired thickness, strain kefir into glass, stirring gently until only kefir grains remain in strainer.
(To keep kefir grains viable, stir into new batch of milk within 48 hours.)
Combine prepared kefir, orange juice, vanilla, and sugar in blender.
Pulse to combine.
Blend in ice cubes individually until as creamy and frothy as you like.
Taste, and blend in more sugar to sweeten as desired.
6a0d7996ca.pred:
1. Identify the main ingredients of the dish:
- Kefir: A fermented milk drink made from kefir grains.
- Orange: A citrus fruit with a sweet and tangy flavor.
- Julius: A brand of orange juice.

2. Provide a step-by-step guide for preparing the dish:
- Combine the kefir and orange juice in a blender or food processor.
- Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
- Pour the mixture into a glass and enjoy.

3. Additional tips or variations:
- If desired, add a pinch of sugar or honey to taste.
- You can also add a splash of vodka or gin for a more adult twist.
- For a more refreshing version, add a handful of fresh mint leaves or a sprig of fresh basil.

4. Provide a brief description of the dish:
Kefir Orange Julius is a delicious and refreshing drink made from kefir, orange juice, and a touch of sugar or honey. It can be enjoyed as a standalone beverage or as a base for a cocktail. To make it, simply blend the kefir and orange juice together, pour the mixture into a glass, and enjoy.

dfe6f1be35.gt:
Heat unsalted butter in a stainless steel, thick-bottomed sauce pan, over a low-medium flame.
Allow the oil (ghee) to separate from the milk solids.
Periodically remove the foam that accumulates at the top.
When the oil is clear in color, the ghee is done.
Remove from the stove and allow to cool for a while, than carefully pour off the ghee into a wide-mouthed jar through several layers of cheese cloth secured to the opening of the jar or through a fine mesh strainer.
Cover the jar and store at room temperature.

e07fd8f60a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Set the squash on a large rimmed baking sheet, cut sides up, and brush with the 3 tablespoons of melted butter.
Sprinkle the sugar in the cavities and season the squash with salt and pepper.
Turn the squash over on the baking sheet and roast for about 1 hour, or until tender and browned at the edges.
Meanwhile, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a medium skillet.
Add the chestnuts and thyme sprigs and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chestnuts are lightly browned and glazed with the butter, 8 to 10 minutes.
Discard the thyme sprigs.
Cut each squash half into 4 wedges and arrange on a large platter.
Sprinkle with the glazed chestnuts and the red currants.
Drizzle the squash with the pomegranate molasses and serve.
e07fd8f60a.pred:
To recreate the Roasted Squash with Chestnuts and Pomegranate, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Cut the squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes.
3. Drizzle the squash with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
4. Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until the flesh is tender and the skin is slightly charred.
5. While the squash is roasting, prepare the chestnuts by removing the shells and peeling the skin. You can either do this by hand or use a chestnut peeler.
6. In a small bowl, mix the chestnuts with a little bit of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
7. Once the squash is cooked, let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Scoop out the squash flesh into a bowl and mash it slightly.
9. Add the chestnuts to the squash mixture and stir to combine.
10. Squeeze a little bit of fresh lemon juice over the mixture to brighten the flavors.
11. Add the pomegranate seeds to the mixture and toss everything together.
12. Serve the Roasted Squash with Chestnuts and Pomegranate as a delicious and healthy side dish or main course.

Enjoy your culinary masterpiece!

6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating between the flour mixture and the milk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
7. Mix until just combined.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.
9. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

93fa251248.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Whisk eggs, oil, and brown sugar together in a bowl until brown sugar is dissolved.
Combine oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into egg mixture just until moistened.
Spoon oat mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
93fa251248.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of rolled oats, 1 cup of milk, 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of melted butter, and 1 egg. Whisk until smooth.

4. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.

3b92f8e755.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
Place a ridged cast-iron skillet or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Working in batches, brush eggplant slices on both sides with olive oil and cook, turning, until soft and (if using a ridged pan) crisscrossed with grid marks.
Set aside and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine feta, pine nuts, raisins, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, bread crumbs, garlic, lemon zest, mint and parsley.
Mix in egg, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spread eggplant slices on a surface, and divide stuffing evenly among them, placing 1 to 2 tablespoons at one end of each slice.
Roll up slices tightly to secure filling, and place in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish (or other shallow baking pan in which rolls fit snugly in a single layer).
Pour crushed tomatoes on top of eggplant rolls.
Arrange mozzarella slices in a line lengthwise down center of pan.
Drizzle olive oil evenly over pan, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Bake until cheese has melted and eggplant is bubbling and fragrant, 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to stand 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

263a0fdd20.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Prepare cake batter as directed on package; pour into parchment-lined 15x10x1-inch pan.
Bake 18 to 20 min.
or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
Cool completely.
Beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl with mixer until creamy.
Blend in vanilla.
Gradually add sugar, beating well after each addition.
Cut cake lengthwise, then crosswise in half.
Stack cake layers on plate, spreading cream cheese frosting between layers and on top of cake.
263a0fdd20.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9x9 inch baking dish.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the following ingredients:
- 1 cup of grated carrots
- 1 cup of shredded coconut
- 1 cup of chopped nuts (e.g., almonds or walnuts)
- 1 cup of all-purpose flour
- 1 cup of granulated sugar
- 1 cup of brown sugar
- 1/2 cup of unsalted butter, softened
- 1/2 cup of milk
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt

- 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg

4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and the milk.

fe5d11c597.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup margarine in large mixer bowl.
Beat at medium speed until creamy.
Add egg and vanilla, and continue beating until well mixed.
Reduce speed to low,and add all remaining cookie ingredients except marshmallows.
Beat until well mixed.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 6-7 minutes or until edges are just set.
Remove from oven.
Press 1 marshmallow half onto center of each cookie.
Continue baking for 2 minutes or until marshmallow is softened.
Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets.
Cool completely.
Combine all frosting ingredients except milk in small mixer bowl.
Beat at low speed, adding enough milk for desired spreading consistency.
Frost cooled cookies, covering entire marshmallow.
Variations: Before putting frosting over cooled cookies, spread a thin layer of peanut butter, caramel, or seedless raspberry jelly over marshmallow, and then add your frosting.

To recreate the culinary masterpiece, follow these instructions:

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.

4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
5. Fold in the chocolate chips and nuts.
6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.

904095d715.gt:
In a 10-inch heavy saute pan, heat 1 ounce of clarified butter over high heat.
Add sliced mushrooms one handful at a time to saute pan.
As mushrooms begin to develop rich, brown color, push them to the outside of the saute pan.
Turn the mushrooms over as they begin to color.
When pan becomes dry, add remaining clarified butter to the pan.
Add another handful of mushrooms to the pan and continue until all mushrooms have been added.
Season with salt and pepper after the last addition to the pan has been made.
Make a hole in the middle of the pan and add the shallots.
Deglaze pan with cognac, scraping up any browned mushroom bits.
Add the chives.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

To recreate the Fungal Saute, follow these instructions:
1. Gather the necessary ingredients:
- 1 cup of mushrooms
- 1/2 cup of olive oil
- 1/4 cup of butter
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Optional: additional herbs or spices, such as thyme, rosemary, or crushed red pepper flakes

2. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the butter to the skillet, and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the mushrooms are cooked through and the butter has melted and turned golden.
5. Season the mushrooms with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the mushrooms to a baking dish, and top with the optional herbs or spices.
7. Bake the mushrooms in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
8. Serve the Fungal Saute hot, as a side dish or a main course.

Enjoy your delicious Fungal Saute!

a562032555.gt:
Mix the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl with a wooden spoon.
In another large bowl, empty the yeast package, then slowly add the warm water, mixing with a fork to fully dissolve the yeast.
When the yeast mixture forms some bubbles, add the mixture to the flour/salt, then add the three eggs.
Mix the batter, then set the bowl on top of your refrigerator (or other warm place), cover with damp dish towel.
After 20 minutes, check the dough for rising, mix again and let rise for another 20 minutes.
In a saucepan, heat the oil to medium heat.
Add the dough by the spoonful (about the size of 2 golf balls) Experiment with the first batch to make sure the oil is not too hot.
Remove when golden brown and place on paper bags to absorb the oil.
Place warm Zeppoles in a paper bag with powdered sugar and SHAKE.
Cover with powdered sugar.

59d1e62c4c.gt:
Heat a saucepan over medium heat.
Melt the butter and stir in the garlic and ginger.

Set aside.
Rinse the chicken wings and pat them dry.
Generously season the chicken with salt and black pepper.
Dredge the wings in flour, shaking off any excess flour, and set aside.
In a large saucepan or deep fryer, heat the oil to about 375.
Fry the chicken wings in small batches until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
Shake off any excess oil and place on paper towels to drain.
Continue frying the chicken in batches until all of the wings are cooked.
Toss the wings in the teriyaki sauce and sprinkle with green onions.

Brew coffee using a ratio of about 1 1/2 tablespoons coffee per cup of water.

Add the room temperature coffee, creamer, raspberry and hazelnut syrups, and the ice into a blender and blend until smooth.

54bc08b13e.gt:
Combine cream, milk, water, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and salt in a medium saucepan.

1. In a saucepan, combine 1 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 cup of granulated sugar, and 1/2 cup of water.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Microwave chocolate in microwaveable bowl on MEDIUM 2 min.
or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring after 1 min.

Stir in 3/4 cup each of the grahams and marshmallows.
Spread onto waxed paper-covered baking sheet.

d3047450d6.gt:
Boil the water and pour a small amount in the teapot, swishing it around to warm the pot.
Combine the mint and green tea and sugar in the teapot, then fill it with the rest of the hot water.
Let the tea brew for three minutes.
Set out glasses for the tea.
A shot-glass is close to the slender glasses used in Morocco.
Fill just one glass with the tea, then pour it back in the pot.
Repeat.
This helps to dissolve and distribute the sugar.
Pour the tea.
You want a nice foam on the tea so always pour with the teapot a high distance above the glasses.
If you do not have at least a little foam on the top of the first glass, then pour it back into the teapot and try again until the tea starts to foam up nicely.
Garnish with the remaining sprigs of mint.

Melt butter and place in the pan you are using for the cobbler

ed226be03e.gt:
Heat oil in a small frying pan over low heat until hot, about 1 minute.
Add chile flakes and remove from heat.
Let cool to room temperature.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer if desired, then transfer to a container and cover until ready to use.
Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.

Makes 15 appetizers.

952ff059c4.gt:
In medium bowl, mix cocoa, sugar and oil.
Beat in the egg replacer; stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir into cocoa mixture.
Cover and chill 4 hours (or put in the freezer for about 30 minutes).
Preheat oven to 350.
Lightly grease cookie sheet.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls.
Using your finger, poke a hole into the ball and place 2 marshmallow pieces inside.
Form dough back into a ball, making sure marshmallow is completely covered; coat with powdered sugar.
Bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.
Leave on cookie sheet for 1 minute and then transfer to a wire rack or brown paper.
EGG REPLACER 1 egg = 2 TBSP water + 1 TBSP oil + 2 tsp baking powder
Make sure you mix these together before adding to the recipe (dont just throw them all into the batter they must be mixed together first).

6. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
7. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Stir the reserved liquid, the salad dressing, honey mustard, relish, celery, carrot, sugar, and salt into the tuna.

a4c28c7c57.gt:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the olive oil and after the oil is hot, stir in the eggplant.
Cook for 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally, until the eggplant is seared.
Stir in the onions, ginger and garlic, and then cook for about 1 minute, or until soft.
(If the pan is too dry from the eggplant absorbing all the oil, add a touch more olive oil when stirring in the onions.)
Reduce heat to low and stir in the coconut milk, fish sauce, curry powder, brown sugar, black pepper and optional chilies.
Simmer for about 2 minutes or until heated through and eggplant has absorbed some of the sauce.
a4c28c7c57.pred:
To prepare the meal, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Cut the eggplant into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
3. Season the eggplant cubes with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cumin.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat. Add a drizzle of oil and cook the eggplant cubes until they are golden brown and tender, stirring occasionally.
5. Remove the cooked eggplant from the pan and set aside.
6. In the same pan, add a drizzle of oil and cook the onions until they are translucent.
7. Add the curry paste to the pan and cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly.
8. Add the coconut milk, water, and any additional seasonings, such as cumin, coriander, and turmeric. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Add the cooked eggplant to the pan and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender and the curry has thickened.
10. Serve the seared eggplant and coconut milk curry over rice or with flatbread, garnished with fresh cilantro and a drizzle of coconut milk.

[/INST]

This meal can be enjoyed as a delicious and flavorful dish, perfect for a warm and comforting dinner. The combination of the seared eggplant and coconut milk curry creates a rich and satisfying taste, making it a great option for a home-cooked meal.

8c7a346bad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a cookie sheet.
Unroll dough on lightly floured surface and press seams together.
Sprinkle one side of block of cream cheese with enough dill to cover.
Place cream cheese, dill side down, in center of dough.
Sprinkle with more dill to cover.
Bring sides of dough up around cheese block and seal to completely enclose.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 15 minutes.
Serve warm.

af9fb785aa.gt:
Preheat oven to 275F/135C.
In a large bowl toss oatmeal, coconut, nuts, and sunflower seeds together.
In a separate bowl whisk together oil, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Pour liquid mixture over oats and stir until everything is coated.
Pour mixture into a large rimmed baking sheet.
I also cover the baking sheet with baking paper but it's not necessary if you have a non-stick pan.
Bake for approximately 20-25 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Keep an eye on it so it doesn't burn.
Let it cool completely.
Blend in cornflakes if using.
Store in an airtight container.

5. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

7. Once the granola is golden brown and fragrant, remove it from the oven and let it cool completely.
8. Once the granola is cool, store it in an airtight container for up to a week.

6f1343402a.gt:
Heat cumin seeds and mustard seed in hot dry skillet over high heat, swirling pan, until seeds start to pop.

Add 2/3 cup water, cover, reduce heat and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until spices are absorbed and potatoes are tender.
Add a small amount of water at a time if all liquid evaporates.
Fold in cilantro just before serving.

Microwave broccoli and CHEEZ WHIZ in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1 min.
or until heated through, stirring after 30 sec.

8. Add the grated Parmesan cheese to the smashed potatoes and stir to combine.

f537025690.gt:
Mix chili sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, and cilantro; set aside.
Divide shrimp into 4 equal portions.
Lay each portion of shrimp in a neat row with tails pointed in the same direction.
Thread 2 thin wood or metal skewers (8 to 10 inches long) about 1 1/2 inches apart through center of each row of shrimp, pushing the shellfish close together.
Place shrimp on an oiled grill above a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas barbecue (you can hold your hand at grill level only 2 to 3 seconds); close lid on gas grill.
Cook, turning once, until shrimp are pink, 2 to 3 minutes a side.
Brush tops of shrimp with the chili sauce mixture, turn over, and cook just until glaze bubbles and browns slightly, about 30 seconds (watch closely; glaze burns easily).
Brush tops with more chili mixture, then turn glaze down and cook just until it darkens slightly, about 30 seconds more.
Transfer shrimp to plates or a platter.
Season to taste with remaining chili mixture and juice from lime wedges.

Place the almonds and water into a blender or food proccesor and turn on high speed to puree.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.

Blend in melted butter.

Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)

Brown ground beef and onion powder in a large skillet over medium heat, drain off fat.

Cut broccoli and cauliflower into smaller pieces.

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.

4. Gradually add the flour, baking powder, and salt to the mixture, stirring until a smooth batter forms.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.

Toss in chilies, stir again, then add coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour, on low, stirring along the way.
Before serving, taste and season with salt or pepper.

This dish is rich, creamy, spicy, funky, and overall totally comforting and right up my alley.

Combine sugar, pecans and orange peel in small bowl.
Melt butter in small bowl in microwave.
Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces the size of butter pat.

Do all 20 biscuits.

Enjoy your delicious Strawberry/ Triple Chocolate Cookie Cake!

f15f7c9832.gt:
Cut the chicken into thin diagonal slices, then into 1 cm strips.
Finely julienne the peppers.
Rub the shio-koji into the chicken.
Add the ingredients and rub to flavor the chicken.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Spread the chicken and cook over high heat until the edges turn white.
Flip over, and brown both sides.
Add the peppers and shio-konbu and stir fry quickly.
Swirl in the sake and it's done!

- Shio-Koji (optional, but highly recommended for enhanced flavor)
- Vegetables of your choice (e.g., bell peppers, onions, mushrooms)
- Soy sauce
- Oil (e.g., vegetable oil)
- Garlic
- Ginger
- Salt and pepper

- Heat a pan or wok over medium heat.

- Add the vegetables to the pan and cook until they are tender.

- If using Shio-Koji, add it to the pan along with the vegetables.

6. Add sauce:
- Pour the soy sauce into the pan and stir to combine with the vegetables.

7. Add chicken back to the pan:
- Add the cooked chicken back to the pan and stir to combine with the sauce.

8. Serve:
- Serve the stir-fried chicken and vegetables over rice or noodles, garnished with sesame seeds and green onions.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful stir-fried chicken breast with Shio-Koji!

57f1deb064.gt:
Heat oven to 400F.
In a large bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, 2 tablespoons of the oil, the garlic, tarragon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Add the chicken and toss to coat.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast until cooked through, about 45 minutes.
During the last 15 minutes of roasting, cook the noodles according to the package directions.
Drain and return to the pot.
Add the parsley and the remaining oil and toss to coat.
Transfer the chicken to individual plates.
Place the pan containing the drippings over medium-high heat.
Add the wine and cook, stirring and scraping the bits from the bottom of the pan, until the wine reduces slightly, about 5 minutes.
Divide the noodles among the plates and spoon the sauce over the top.
57f1deb064.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and a pinch of paprika.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add a drizzle of oil. Sear the chicken for a few minutes on each side until browned.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add a splash of water and cook the onions until they are soft and translucent.
6. Add the garlic and cook for a few more seconds.
7. Pour in the chicken broth and bring the mixture to a simmer.
8. Add the chicken back to the skillet, nestling it among the vegetables.

10. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into portions.
11. Cook the egg noodles according to the package instructions.
12. Serve the chicken with the egg noodles and a side of mustard-tarragon sauce.
